intro: Dasymaschalon scandens, commonly known as the climbing dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a vine, climbing or trailing along the ground or other vegetation. Its flowers are yellow, resembling those of the common dandelion, and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
